intro: Matelea stellulifera, commonly known as the starry matelea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, with a distinctive star-like pattern on the petals. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Matelea stellulifera is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, with deep roots that help it access water in dry soils.
